intro: Orthodon grosseserratus, commonly known as the roughleaf orthodon, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. Orthodon grosseserratus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
